present.title: Doe's Dark Brownies
present.caption: These Brownies will change your life
present.profileSummary:
Hi! I'm Jane, a software developer at Vistaprint. I work on the front-end for the studio team. In my spare time I love reading and jogging.
I've been living in Boston for over 10 years now, but I'm originally from Texas. This recipe is a hand-me-down from my grandmother and I'm excited to share it with you!
present.ingredients:
• 1/2 cup butter
  • 1 cup white sugar
  • 2 eggs
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
  • 1/3 cup unsweetened cocoa powder
  • 1/2 cup all-purpose flour
  • 1/4 teaspoon salt
  • 1/4 teaspoon baking powder
present.directions:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour an 8-inch square pan.
  2. In a large saucepan, melt 1/2 cup butter. Remove from heat, and stir in sugar, eggs, and 1 teaspoon vanilla. Beat in 1/3 cup cocoa, 1/2 cup flour, salt, and baking powder. Spread batter into prepared pan.
  3. Bake in preheated oven for 25 to 30 minutes. Do not overcook.
